intro: Cyanea hanaensis, commonly known as the Hanaean Cyanea, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Cyanea hanaensis is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance in Hawaiian ecosystems.
